channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: What to know about arson and explosives units after blast at training facility in Los Angeles
EPA shutters its scientific research arm, with hundreds expected to be impacted
item.description: The EPA's Office of Research and Development has more than 1,500 employees, including scientists and researchers, dispersed across the U.S.

item.title: Trump sues Murdoch and Wall Street Journal over Epstein article
item.description: The $10bn lawsuit is over a story claiming the president wrote a "bawdy" personal note to Jeffrey Epstein in 2003.

item.title: 3 deputies killed in LA explosion at sheriff's department training facility
item.description: Senior law enforcement officials said the LASD bomb squad responded to a garage in Santa Monica yesterday, where at least one grenade was found. It wa...

item.title: 'The village will die' - Italy looks for answers to decline in number of babies
item.description: The government wants to encourage women to have babies but Italians say they need greater help.

item.title: Syrian presidency to send new force to halt clashes in south
item.description: The Syrian leader's move comes after days of clashes between Bedouin and Druze fighters in Suweida, reported to have killed hundreds.

item.title: Two surrogates speak out about California couple under investigation
Court orders Bolsonaro to wear ankle tag and puts him under curfew
item.description: A court in Brazil also bars the ex-president from using social media and puts him under 24-hour surveillance.

item.title: CBS News poll: Most Americans favor U.S. returning to moon, going to Mars
item.description: Many think the space program adds to feelings of national pride and patriotism, a CBS News poll shows.

item.title: This week on "Sunday Morning" (July 20)
item.description: A look at the features for this week's broadcast of the Emmy-winning program, hosted by Jane Pauley.

item.title: US tech CEO suspended after Coldplay concert embrace goes viral
item.description: Big screen footage of the two people went viral after reports they were colleagues and at least one was married to another person.

item.title: Americans on whether the U.S. should return to the moon, travel to Mars
item.description: Sunday marks the 56th anniversary of the Apollo 11 mission -- the first to land humans on the moon. Now, NASA is in a multiyear effort to return astro...

item.title: Brazil's Bolsonaro ordered to wear ankle monitor ahead of trial
item.description: Authorities in Brazil, worried that the former far right president is a flight risk, are imposing new restrictions on his movements. The tough surveil...

item.title: Trump says no one cares about Epstein. Why won't his base let it go?
item.description: One of the narratives at the heart of President Trump's political movement is this: American society is dominated by a shadowy group of elites, and th...

item.title: 10 Americans are freed by Venezuela in a prisoner swap for migrants in El Salvador
item.description: Venezuela has freed 10 Americans in exchange for Venezuelans whom the United States had sent to a prison in El Salvador.

item.title: Funding cuts will hit rural areas hard. One station manager explains how
item.description: NPR's Juana Summers speaks with Tom Michael, general manager of Boise State Public Radio, about what the cuts to federal public media funding mean for...

item.title: New U.S. Postal Service head says he doesn't believe in privatizing the mail agency
item.description: Postmaster General David Steiner told USPS workers he doesn't believe in privatizing the agency. President Trump has expressed support for such a move...

item.title: Training facility blast kills 3 LA deputies in one of sheriff’s department’s worst losses of life
item.description: An explosion at a Los Angeles County Sheriff’s Department training facility killed three veteran deputies from the arson and explosives unit.
